answers.answer: Hi Puzzled, Yes I do think you have ED, I had the same thing and goit my self out with some herbs and a hormone, its cheaper way to than drugs and safer, I will email you 2 of my posts and see how you get on, and please give them a good read, then a 12 week trial, about 4 to 6 weeks you should if its working start getting nocternal erections and morning woods, just Google this tital, DRUGS VERSUS HERBS, HERBS MY CHOICE, this will find you the post and the site its on, its an ED site, lots of guys like us with the same problems.Your testicle pain may be just a build up of sperm, if you read it can do that.Good Luck

You need to get checked out.  You could have a thyroid issue.  Sometimes guys don't take any symptoms seriously except sexual ones.  It could be diabetes.  You need to get everything checked out, and soon.  A painful testicle should always get checked for torsion.

question: Hi,I'm a 49 year old male. Last year I developed gynecomastia on my left side; the year before that my sex drive started to plummet for the first time; my erections are now weak and intercourse is therefore brief; my total testosterone about three months ago was a flat 300; I still have no sex drive and now some e.d.; i suspect that on those rare occasions (once every few months) I do have sex, I sometimes have dry orgasm; and for the past two days my left testicle started paining me and swelling somewhat.Clearly I need to see/change my doctor. But tell me: What are the possibilities here?Puzzled
title: first low libido then gynecomastia now testicular pain. what next?
